etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "big") + 十(十) (shí, "ten") = a concept suggesting abundance or the foundation of greatness -> root

examples.chinese: 树的夲深埋在土中(樹的夲深埋在土中)。
examples.pinyin: Shù de tuō shēn mài zài tǔ zhōng.
examples.english: The tree's root is deeply buried in the soil.

examples.chinese: 古人崇尚夲(古人崇尚夲)，认为夲乃生命之源(認為夲乃生命之源)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén chóngshàng tuō, rènwéi tuō nǎi shēngmìng zhī yuán.
examples.english: Ancient people revered the root, considering it the source of life.
